AD_FatherSeesDeadMother.synopsis: Gortash's mother, Dravo, sees the corpse of his dead wife, Sally.
AD_FatherSeesDeadMother.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- goto -36 22 -109- Kill Gortash's mother, Sally Flymm- When Dravo sees Sally's corpse, he will say this AD

AD_GortashFather_Idle.synopsis: Gortash's father, Dravo, repeats these lines in his idle behaviour if he sees a player.
AD_GortashFather_Idle.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- goto -36 22 -109- Walk into the Flymms' shop.- Observe Dravo Flymm, Gortash's father, saying these lines, when he sees a player.

AD_MotherSeesDeadFather.synopsis: Gortash's mother, Sally, sees the corpse of her dead husband, Dravo.
AD_MotherSeesDeadFather.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- goto -36 22 -109- Kill Gortash's father, Dravo Flymm- When Sally sees Dravo's corpse, she will say this AD

AD_GortashMother_Idle.synopsis: Gortash's mother, Sally, repeats these lines in her idle behaviour.
AD_GortashMother_Idle.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- goto -36 22 -109- Observe Sally Flymm, Gortash's mother, in her idle behaviour.

GortashFather.synopsis: Default dialogue for Gortash's father, Dravo Flymm, at Flymm Cobblers in the Lower City. Gortash tadpoled his parents, who sold him into slavery in his youth. They are aware of their state but cannot resist the tadpole's compulsion - which makes them appear as huge fans of their son.
GortashFather.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- goto -36 22 -109- Talk to Gortash's father, Dravo Flymm.

PAD_GortashPortrait.synopsis: A player either notices Gortash's portrait in his family home (Flymm Cobblers) by succeeding a perception check, or they interacts with the portrait. Players may or may not already know that this house belongs to Gortash's parents.
PAD_GortashPortrait.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- goto -36 22 -109- Walk towards Gortash's portrait inside the house with roll amazing on or interact with it.

GortashFather_Dead.synopsis: Speak With Dead dialogue for Gortash's father, Dravo Flymm. Gortash tadpoled his parents, who sold him into slavery in his youth. They were aware of their state but cannot resist the tadpole's compulsion - which made them appear to be huge fans of their son. When they die, the tadpole loses its grip over them.
GortashFather_Dead.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- goto -36 22 -109- Kill Gortash's father, Dravo Flymm:"select S_LOW_GortashFamilyHome_GortashFather""setHPPercentage 0"- Use Speak With Dead on his corpse

GortashMother_Dead.synopsis: Speak With Dead dialogue for Gortash's mother, Sally Flymm. Gortash tadpoled his parents, who sold him into slavery in his youth. They were aware of their state but cannot resist the tadpole's compulsion - which made them appear to be huge fans of their son. When they die, the tadpole loses its grip over them.
GortashMother_Dead.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- goto -36 22 -109- Kill Gortash's mother, Sally Flymm:"select S_LOW_GortashFamilyHome_GortashMother""setHPPercentage 0"- Use Speak With Dead on her corpse

GortashMother.synopsis: Default dialogue for Gortash's mother, Sally Flymm, at Flymm Cobblers in the Lower City. Gortash tadpoled his parents, who sold him into slavery in his youth. They are aware of their state but cannot resist the tadpole's compulsion - which makes them appear as huge fans of their son.
GortashMother.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- goto -36 22 -109- Talk to Gortash's mother, Sally Flymm.

AD_GortashFather_Idle_0.speaker: Dravo Flymm
AD_GortashFather_Idle_0.text: He had so much time left.

AD_GortashFather_Idle_3.speaker: Dravo Flymm
AD_GortashFather_Idle_3.text: I'd love to cobble for our Archduke. He wouldn't turn down his old man, would he?

AD_GortashFather_Idle_4.speaker: Dravo Flymm
AD_GortashFather_Idle_4.text: Enver was the best of us. All the good.

AD_GortashFather_Idle_5.speaker: Dravo Flymm
AD_GortashFather_Idle_5.text: Trotting around this city is hard work. And we've got the perfect trotters.

AD_GortashFather_Idle_6.speaker: Dravo Flymm
AD_GortashFather_Idle_6.text: Perhaps we should change our name to Gortash.

AD_GortashMother_Idle_0.speaker: Sally Flymm
AD_GortashMother_Idle_0.text: It ought to have been us, not him.

AD_GortashMother_Idle_1.speaker: Sally Flymm
AD_GortashMother_Idle_1.text: Our lovely boy. Our perfect boy.

AD_GortashMother_Idle_2.speaker: Sally Flymm
AD_GortashMother_Idle_2.text: May need to shutter early to celebrate.

AD_GortashMother_Idle_3.speaker: Sally Flymm
AD_GortashMother_Idle_3.text: Should've been cordwainers - but leather was so dear back then.

AD_GortashMother_Idle_4.speaker: Sally Flymm
AD_GortashMother_Idle_4.text: No one should have to bury their child.

AD_GortashMother_Idle_5.speaker: Sally Flymm
AD_GortashMother_Idle_5.context: NodeContext: implying her 'true' personality almost broke through, but it dind't

AD_GortashMother_Idle_6.speaker: Sally Flymm
AD_GortashMother_Idle_6.text: Lovely outside, isn't it? Reminds me of Enver's second birthday.

GortashFather_21.speaker: Dravo Flymm
GortashFather_21.text: Be very welcome to Flymm's Cobblers! Humble family home of our soon-to-be Archduke Enver Gortash!

GortashFather_23.speaker: Dravo Flymm
GortashFather_23.text: Very good to see you again!

GortashFather_24.speaker: Dravo Flymm
GortashFather_24.text: We're closed for business today. Apologies.

GortashFather_13.speaker: Dravo Flymm
GortashFather_13.text: Our son - our beautiful boy, Enver, has been killed. Right before his prime. He was meant to be the Archduke, you know. Such senseless violence.

GortashFather_33.speaker: Dravo Flymm
GortashFather_33.text: Be very welcome to Flymm's Cobblers! Humble family home of our Archduke Enver Gortash!

GortashFather_22.speaker: Dravo Flymm
GortashFather_22.text: He may not have followed in his old man's shoe-steps, but Archduke's not so bad, is it?

GortashFather_26.speaker: Karlach
GortashFather_26.text: Gortash's dad. Same treatment as his mum, I guess.

GortashFather_20.speaker: Karlach
GortashFather_20.text: Gortash's dad. And he seems... proud.

GortashFather_34.speaker: Dravo Flymm
GortashFather_34.text: Finest leather in the city - ask anyone!

GortashFather_9.speaker: Narrator
GortashFather_9.text: *Nothing. It's as though the inner workings of his mind have been wiped clean.*

GortashFather_25.speaker: Dravo Flymm
GortashFather_25.text: What are you doing?! Stop that right now!

GortashFather_19.speaker: Narrator
GortashFather_19.text: *You delve into his mind and find... nothing. Like someone or something has drained his mind of all personality.*

GortashFather_31.speaker: Narrator
GortashFather_31.text: *You focus on the source of the power, but it is quiet and still. It needs to rest.*

GortashFather_18.speaker: Dravo Flymm
GortashFather_18.text: He's the image of me, isn't he? Always was a handsome devil.

GortashFather_37.speaker: Dravo Flymm
GortashFather_37.text: He was the image of me. And the best of me. Everything he accomplished... Gods, he made us so proud.

GortashFather_5.speaker: Player
GortashFather_5.text: This man is nothing more than a puppet now. Put him out of his misery.

GortashFather_0.speaker: Player
GortashFather_0.text: I know what you did to your son. I know you sold him into slavery.

GortashFather_12.speaker: Dravo Flymm
GortashFather_12.text: You've got the wrong family. Enver's the light of our lives. He grew up right in these walls - first my apprentice, then saviour of the city, and on to Archduke.

GortashFather_8.speaker: Dravo Flymm
GortashFather_8.text: Nothing untoward about it, I assure you.

GortashFather_Dead_20.speaker: Narrator
GortashFather_Dead_20.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

GortashFather_Dead_19.speaker: Dravo Flymm
GortashFather_Dead_19.text: Dravo... Flymm... father of... Enver Flymm... Gortash...

GortashFather_Dead_17.speaker: Player
GortashFather_Dead_17.text: What was Gortash like as a child?

GortashFather_Dead_3.speaker: Dravo Flymm
GortashFather_Dead_3.text: Too much... trouble... needed... money... sold him off...

GortashFather_Dead_0.speaker: Player
GortashFather_Dead_0.text: Does Gortash have any weaknesses I can use against him?

GortashFather_Dead_18.speaker: Dravo Flymm
GortashFather_Dead_18.text: Clever boy... always... tinkering. Traps... mechanisms...

GortashFather_Dead_28.speaker: Dravo Flymm
GortashFather_Dead_28.text: Steel Watchers... were his... greatest weapon...

GortashFather_Dead_22.speaker: Dravo Flymm
GortashFather_Dead_22.text: Steel Watchers... are his... greatest weapon...

GortashFather_Dead_8.speaker: Dravo Flymm
GortashFather_Dead_8.text: Enver... came to us... forced worm... into our heads...

GortashFather_Dead_14.speaker: Dravo Flymm
GortashFather_Dead_14.text: Revenge... for... selling him... had no... choice...

GortashFather_Dead_5.speaker: Player
GortashFather_Dead_5.text: Why did you sell your son?

GortashFather_Dead_4.speaker: Dravo Flymm
GortashFather_Dead_4.text: Heavy debts... no way to repay...

GortashFather_Dead_10.speaker: Dravo Flymm
GortashFather_Dead_10.text: Trouble... with Guild... warlock offered... good coin...

GortashFather_Dead_25.speaker: Narrator
GortashFather_Dead_25.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

GortashFather_Dead_27.speaker: Narrator
GortashFather_Dead_27.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

GortashMother_Dead_21.speaker: Narrator
GortashMother_Dead_21.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

GortashMother_Dead_20.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_Dead_20.text: Sally... Flymm... mother of... Enver. Flymm... Gortash...

GortashMother_Dead_18.speaker: Player
GortashMother_Dead_18.text: What can you tell me about your son?

GortashMother_Dead_25.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_Dead_25.text: I should have ended him... in the womb...

GortashMother_Dead_6.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_Dead_6.text: Dreadful child... sold him to a warlock... to save our shop...

GortashMother_Dead_3.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_Dead_3.text: At least... he got... to live.

GortashMother_Dead_0.speaker: Player
GortashMother_Dead_0.text: Is there anything I can do to gain an advantage over Gortash?

GortashMother_Dead_23.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_Dead_23.text: Start with the big... metal... freaks...

GortashMother_Dead_1.speaker: Player
GortashMother_Dead_1.text: How did you come to be tadpoled?

GortashMother_Dead_15.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_Dead_15.text: Wanted us... to feel... what he felt. Powerless...

GortashMother_Dead_5.speaker: Player
GortashMother_Dead_5.text: Why did you sell your son into slavery?

GortashMother_Dead_11.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_Dead_11.text: It was... the only thing... we could do...

GortashMother_Dead_26.speaker: Narrator
GortashMother_Dead_26.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

GortashMother_Dead_28.speaker: Narrator
GortashMother_Dead_28.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

GortashMother_51.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_51.text: Ah, saer, be very welcome to the family home of the soon-sworn Archduke, Enver Gortash!

GortashMother_55.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_55.text: Pardon us, saer. This house is in mourning.

GortashMother_32.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_32.text: Our son, the city's saviour Enver Gortash, was slain by Absolutist conspirators.

GortashMother_78.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_78.text: Ah, saer, you've chosen a special day to visit the family home of Archduke Enver Gortash.

GortashMother_16.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_16.text: We're celebrating our dear son's magnificent achievement with a special run of leather-soled shoes.

GortashMother_82.speaker: Karlach
GortashMother_82.text: Gods - Gortash has a mother?! I assumed he sprang fully-formed from a lich's arsecrack or something.
GortashMother_82.context: NodeContext: Aside, to the player, not too loud.

GortashMother_17.speaker: Player
GortashMother_17.text: Connect your tadpole to hers - delve into her mind.

GortashMother_11.speaker: Narrator
GortashMother_11.text: *You search her mind, but the psionic forces that control her are different - split, somehow. Your own consciousness slips into the gap.*

GortashMother_70.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_70.text: Help me. Gods, help me! Enver's ruined my mind. He's taken my body!

GortashMother_81.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_81.text: I should've slammed the door in his face. But I let him in, and he rammed some kind of worm in our eyes.

GortashMother_39.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_39.text: I'm here. But I can't speak. I can't act. I'm trapped.

GortashMother_48.speaker: Player
GortashMother_48.text: You're not the only one he's hurt. Why would he do this?

GortashMother_61.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_61.text: He said he wanted to make us 'powerless'.

GortashMother_58.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_58.text: Still bitter after all these years. But we did what was best for him - for all of us.

GortashMother_3.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_3.text: We had debts. World-ending debts, trying to keep this cursed shop afloat. Dangerous lenders who said they'd bury us all if we didn't pay.

GortashMother_42.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_42.text: Then, a warlock offered us a pretty penny for Enver's service. He was a smart boy - too smart. It was give him up - and all of us live - or refuse, and die.

GortashMother_71.speaker: Player
GortashMother_71.text: You had every choice. You sold your son to a warlock - that's unforgivable.

GortashMother_12.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_12.text: We got good coin for him. Closed our debts, and all of us kept our lives - Enver included.
GortashMother_12.context: NodeContext: 'tiefling' spat out with hatred. She's a racist nasty.

GortashMother_59.speaker: Player
GortashMother_59.text: I feel bad for Gortash. That's a first.

GortashMother_45.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_45.text: Don't you judge me, tiefling. We got good coin for him. Closed our debts, and all of us kept our lives - Enver included.

GortashMother_34.speaker: Player
GortashMother_34.text: You may not have intended to, but you created a monster.

GortashMother_10.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_10.text: He was always a little monster. Nasty to the core. He would've torn me and Dravo apart with his whining, his demands, the never-ending racket of him!

GortashMother_67.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_67.text: You may disagree. Enver did. But we don't deserve this - this torment. You're the first person who's heard the real me in months.

GortashMother_1.speaker: Player
GortashMother_1.text: Why would I help you after what you did to your own son?

GortashMother_68.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_68.text: My son! You've seen what he's like. Same now as when he was a boy. Hateful little wretch.

GortashMother_74.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_74.text: If you were me, you'd've sent him away too. Believe you me.

GortashMother_26.speaker: Player
GortashMother_26.text: You deserve what you got - and more.

GortashMother_9.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_9.text: Maybe. Maybe not. It's for the gods to judge me - not my wicked son. And not you.

GortashMother_76.speaker: Player
GortashMother_76.text: There's nothing I can do for you, at least for now - I'm sorry.

GortashMother_69.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_69.text: There has to be. I can't live like this. I'm trapped - trapped!

GortashMother_36.speaker: Player
GortashMother_36.text: I can put you out of your misery, if you like.

GortashMother_52.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_52.text: There has to be another way. I deserve to live again - I deserve my own life!

GortashMother_60.speaker: Narrator
GortashMother_60.text: *Your tadpole lashes and recoils. The connection is broken.*

GortashMother_22.speaker: Player
GortashMother_22.text: A very fair trade, if you ask me.

GortashMother_63.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_63.text: At least we all lived - Enver included. But he didn't see it that way. Stormed in here like we were murderers and he was the hand of justice itself.

GortashMother_0.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_0.text: You can't leave us like this. You're the first person who's heard the real me in months.

GortashMother_65.speaker: Player
GortashMother_65.text: Why would Enver do this to you?

GortashMother_20.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_20.text: We hadn't seen him in so long. I knew he was an animal, but I underestimated him.

GortashMother_57.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_57.text: He sauntered in. 'Lord Gortash'. What a name. Conjured up like a cheap trick. Said he was back - for good - and he wanted to repay us for his childhood.

GortashMother_64.speaker: Player
GortashMother_64.text: He infected you with a mind flayer tadpole. I have one too - but for now, they can't be cured.

GortashMother_27.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_27.text: You can't leave me like this. You can't leave me in this hell!

GortashMother_8.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_8.text: I hope he rots in the Hells, where he belongs. He always was a nasty little monster.

GortashMother_77.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_77.text: I should've killed him when he was babe in my lap. He was a nasty little freak, even then. The bastard. The bastard!

GortashMother_53.speaker: Narrator
GortashMother_53.text: *You focus on the source of the power, but it is quiet and still. It needs to rest.*

GortashMother_7.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_7.text: Help me. Dear gods, help me!

GortashMother_56.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_56.text: You will keep your magic in hand, saer. In our Enver's own home! Disgusting.

GortashMother_15.speaker: Player
GortashMother_15.text: A pleasure to meet the mother of the Archduke.

GortashMother_46.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_46.text: His one and only. My, but he's made us proud. Such humble beginnings, and look at him now.

GortashMother_47.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_47.text: I've been crying happy tears all this tenday. What more could a mother want for her little boy?

GortashMother_38.speaker: Player
GortashMother_38.text: So you're to blame for the rise of that charlatan.

GortashMother_30.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_30.text: You've chosen the wrong household to argue politics, my friend. Shop, if you like, but let's talk no more of my son.

GortashMother_31.speaker: Player
GortashMother_31.text: Do I take it you're Lord Gortash's mother?

GortashMother_19.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_19.text: May he rest in peace, our sweet boy. This world will never see his like again.
GortashMother_19.context: NodeContext: Sad; her son is dead

GortashMother_13.speaker: Narrator
GortashMother_13.text: *Your tadpole squirms. These people are infected with the parasite - but something is... off.*

GortashMother_2.speaker: Player
GortashMother_2.text: I know what you did. I know that you sold your son into slavery.

GortashMother_29.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_29.text: Oh. Oh no. You have things very, very wrong. A dutiful mother would never do something so heinous. A good mother couldn't have fathomed such a horror.
GortashMother_29.context: NodeContext: A little uncanny, since the paradox of her brain is being called into question.

GortashMother_80.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_80.text: We love our son Enver. We love him so much.

GortashMother_72.speaker: Player
GortashMother_72.text: Show me what you have in stock.

GortashMother_83.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_83.text: That's generations of tradition for you!

GortashMother_4.speaker: Player
GortashMother_4.text: Put her out of her misery - violently.

GortashMother_73.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_73.text: My goodness! What are you doing?!

GortashMother_86.speaker: Sally Flymm
GortashMother_86.text: May he rest in peace, our lad.
